definition: to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
surname Shi
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to stop/to prohibit/until/only

sentences.english: Remember to stop, do not let me pierce the paper goes on already full of loopholes.
sentences.chinese: 記得適可而止，別讓我捅破那張早已漏洞百出的紙。

sentences.english: Not to pay, to know not overdo sth.
sentences.chinese: 㪷翡得不到的付出，要懂得適可而止。

sentences.english: And this means nothing other than that starting from there I cannot go (7) any further.
sentences.chinese: 這道道地地意味着，從這裏開始，我該適可而止了。

sentences.english: I don't mind loud music once in a while, but enough is enough.
sentences.chinese: 我偶爾還可以忍受吵雜的音樂，但是請適可而止。

sentences.english: Is lying acceptable if you are committed to stopping when you can?
sentences.chinese: 如果能夠做到適可而止，那麼謊言能夠被接受嗎？

sentences.english: It also means maintaining a reasonable approach to things like alcohol and caffeine.
sentences.chinese: 這也意味着對於像酒精和咖啡因的東西要適可而止。

sentences.english: It's time to say enough is enough.
sentences.chinese: 是時候說應該適可而止了。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
bad habit (e.g. nose-picking)/petty maneuver/dirty trick/gamesmanship
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
(longstanding) opponent/enemy/inimical/adversary/opponent
correct/normal/to be on good terms with/on the right track/right
to talk nonsense/nonsense!
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to both be willing/mutual consent
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
about a year
brazen
